content.description: Researchers studying two populations of wolves conducted a two-sample <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for the difference in means to investigate whether the mean weight of the wolves in one population was different from the mean weight of the wolves in the other population. All conditions for inference were met, and the test produced a test statistic of <math alttext="t equals 2.771" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.771</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and a <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of 0.01.
content.question: Which of the following is a correct interpretation of the <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value?

choices.label: Assuming that the mean weights of wolves in the populations are equal, the probability of obtaining a test statistic that is greater than 2.771 or less than <math alttext="negative 2.771" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2.771</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is 0.01.
Assuming that the mean weights of wolves in the populations are equal, the probability of obtaining a test statistic that is greater than 2.771 is 0.01.

Assuming that the mean weights of wolves in the populations are different, the probability of obtaining a test statistic that is greater than 2.771 or less than <math alttext="negative 2.771" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2.771</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is 0.01.
Assuming that the mean weights of wolves in the populations are different, the probability of obtaining a test statistic that is greater than 2.771 is 0.01.
Assuming that the mean weights of wolves in the populations are different, the probability of obtaining a test statistic that is less than 2.771 is 0.01.

content.answer: Assuming that the mean weights of wolves in the populations are equal, the probability of obtaining a test statistic that is greater than 2.771 or less than <math alttext="negative 2.771" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2.771</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is 0.01.

topic.text: 7.9: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Means

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
